channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Member of Elon Musk's DOGE team resigns after racist posts resurface
item.description: Marko Elez had recently been given special access by a federal judge to highly sensitive payment systems in the Department of Treasury.
item.content:encoded:
Marko Elez had recently been given special access by a federal judge to highly sensitive payment systems in the Department of Treasury.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: NASA instructs employees to remove pronouns from all work communications
item.description: An email seen by NPR says the move is to comply with a presidential order to "restore biological truth" to the government.
item.content:encoded:
An email seen by NPR says the move is to comply with a presidential order to "restore biological truth" to the government.

(Image credit: Celal Gunes)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: U.K.'s foreign office cat Palmerston shows up for duty in Bermuda
item.description: The former rescue feline joined the British diplomatic service in 2016 and gained a large following online for fulfilling his duty with charisma. He retired in 2020 but is back in action now.
item.content:encoded:
The former rescue feline joined the British diplomatic service in 2016 and gained a large following online for fulfilling his duty with charisma. He retired in 2020 but is back in action now.

(Image credit: Justin Tallis)
item.dc:creator: Manuela López Restrepo

item.title: USAID cut dramatically as officials address 'stunning and irresponsible' changes
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio approved less than 300 essential personnel as USAID staff in the U.S. and overseas rush to rapidly close missions and leave jobs by midnight Friday.
item.content:encoded:
Secretary of State Marco Rubio approved less than 300 essential personnel as USAID staff in the U.S. and overseas rush to rapidly close missions and leave jobs by midnight Friday.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Jenna McLaughlin

item.title: Historic Black church given 'Proud Boys' trademark calls for stand against hate
item.description: A judge ordered the naming rights of the extremist group the Proud Boys be given to the Metropolitan African Methodist Episcopal Church in Washington, D.C.
item.content:encoded:
A judge ordered the naming rights of the extremist group the Proud Boys be given to the Metropolitan African Methodist Episcopal Church in Washington, D.C.

(Image credit: Mark Wilson)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Bill Gates is optimistic about the global future
item.description: In a wide-ranging interview with NPR, Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates expressed concern about the new administration's recent steps to pull back from approach to public health but says he's optimistic about the future and wants to find common ground with the White House.
item.content:encoded:
In a wide-ranging interview with NPR, Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates expressed concern about the new administration's recent steps to pull back from approach to public health but says he's optimistic about the future and wants to find common ground with the White House.

(Image credit: Jae C. Hong)
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Italian politicians allege Donald Trump Jr.'s hunting party killed a protected duck
item.description: Italian politicians want action against a hunting party that included the president's son, who they accuse of allegedly killing a ruddy shelduck. One Italian paper called it the "Donald Duck crisis."
item.content:encoded:
Italian politicians want action against a hunting party that included the president's son, who they accuse of allegedly killing a ruddy shelduck. One Italian paper called it the "Donald Duck crisis."

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: Bone appétit! Dog treats from lab-grown meat are hitting the U.K. market
item.description: Experts say a fifth of U.K. meat consumption is by pets, not people. If Fido eats lab-grown meat, they say, it could cut the country's carbon footprint.
item.content:encoded:
Experts say a fifth of U.K. meat consumption is by pets, not people. If Fido eats lab-grown meat, they say, it could cut the country's carbon footprint.

(Image credit: John Keeble)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Revenge of the Super Bowl Playlists: Philly Over Everybody
item.description: This Sunday, the Philadelphia Eagles and the Kansas City Chiefs go head-to-head on the championship stage once more. Gear up for the game with this Philly-centric music mix.
item.content:encoded:
This Sunday, the Philadelphia Eagles and the Kansas City Chiefs go head-to-head on the championship stage once more. Gear up for the game with this Philly-centric music mix.

(Image credit: Mitchell Leff)
item.dc:creator: Miguel Perez

item.title: Today's local history makers: We want to hear who is making Black history near you
item.description: It's Black History Month and the Up First newsletter wants to highlight local history makers. Do you know anyone who has made a difference and should be celebrated this month? If so, we want to hear.
item.content:encoded:
It's Black History Month and the Up First newsletter wants to highlight local history makers. Do you know anyone who has made a difference and should be celebrated this month? If so, we want to hear.

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton
